title.narrative: Balance of Australia's commitment to HIPC - IDA15

description.narrative: The Highly Indebted Poor Countries (HIPC) Initiative is an agreement among official creditors, managed by the World Bank and IMF, designed to help the poorest, most heavily indebted countries escape from unsustainable debt. The HIPC Initiative includes foreign debts owed to bilateral creditors (Paris Club), multilateral creditors (international financial institutions) and commercial creditors. The debt relief initiatives are enabling low-income members the ability to allocate resources to poverty-reducing and human development expenditures. It is assisting these countries to meet the MDGs. The impact differs from country to country, depending on their level of indebtedness, but by reducing debt burden it is leading to a corresponding increase in spending towards social support programs, such as health and education.
